revised_title: Isolation and Study of the Nitrifying Organism
tldr: The authors, Percy F. Frankland and Grace C. Frankland, conducted experiments to isolate the nitrifying organism and study its behavior. They discovered that the nitrifying organism is a type of bacillus that refuses to grow in gelatin but thrives in broth. This discovery helped in understanding the process of nitrification and its role in soil science.
